original: Block, Bertil Wilhelm, lektor, Visby, f. 3/4/12 i Gbg av biskop Carl B. o. Elisabet Bolin. G. 46 m. Else Nilsson. Barn: Pontus f. 47. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 30, fil. ikand. där 32, teol. kand. i Lund 37, teol’. lic. där 40 o. teol. dr 43, provår v. HvitfeMtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 44-45. Stud:re!sa t. Tyskl. 38. E. adj. i Ystad 43-44, bitr. lär. .samt timlär. v. Hvitfeldt-ska h. a. 1. 44-45, e. adj. där 45-46, lektor v. Visby h. a. 1. 46. Gbgs nat. i Lund kur. 38-39, ordf. i Lunds stud:-kår 41, förest, f. J. H. Thomanders stud:hem i Lund 41-43, sekr. i Goul. Hum. förb. 46. Skr.: Pontus Wikner, en stud. i hans relig:fil. o. teol. åskådning (grad:avh. 43), Den wiknerska boksaml. (43), art. i Sv. teol. kvar-talskr., Pedagog. Tidskr., Tidn. f. Sv. Lärov. m. fl.
translated: Block, Bertil Wilhelm, lecturer, Visby, born April 3, 1912 in Gothenburg to Bishop Carl B. and Elisabet Bolin. Married in 1946 to Else Nilsson. Children: Pontus (born 1947). He obtained his high school diploma in Gothenburg in 1930, completed his bachelor's degree there in 1932, obtained a Bachelor of Theology degree from Lund in 1937, a Candidate of Theology degree there in 1940, and a Doctor of Theology degree in 1943. He spent a probationary year at Hvitfeldtska high school in Gothenburg from 1944-1945, took a study trip to Germany in 1938, served as an assistant in Ystad from 1943-1944, and was a part-time teacher and assistant lecturer at Hvitfeldtska high school from 1944-1946. He became a lecturer at Visby high school in 1946. He was a member of the Gothenburg Natural History Society during his student years at Lund from 1938-1939, served as chairman of the Lund student union in 1941, was in charge of J. H. Thomander's student home in Lund from 1941-1943, and was secretary of the Swedish Humanities Association in 1946. He has written a thesis titled "Pontus Wikner, a student of his religious philosophy and theology," (degree awarded in 1943), "The Wikner Book Collection" (1943), articles in Swedish theological journals, pedagogical journals, and newspapers for Swedish educators, and more.
